metadata.title: CVE-2020-25723 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A reachable assertion issue was found in the USB EHCI emulation code of QEMU. It could occur while processing USB requests due to missing handling of DMA memory map failure. A malicious privileged user within the guest may abuse this flaw to send bogus USB requests and crash the QEMU process on the host, resulting in a denial of service.

criterions.comment: qemu package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
